info.title: AI Companion
info.description: The Zoom AI Companion APIs let you manage user interactions with the AI Companion, no matter which service the panel was opened in. They also support archiving prompts and responses.

get.description:
Retrieve the AI Companion conversation archives.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `aic_archive:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `aic:read:conversation_archives:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
AI Companion conversation archive returned.

start_time.description: The AI Companion conversation history start time.

end_time.description: The AI Companion conversation history end time.

timezone.description: The AI Companion conversation history timezone.

aic_history_download_url.description:
The URL to download the the AI Companion conversion history file. 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains account user scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the AIC conversation history file for the user. For example, `https://{{base-domain}}/rest/v1/aic/archive/conversations/download/xxx--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{OAuth-access-token}}'`.

file_extension.description: The AI Companion data file's extension.

file_size.description: The AI Companion data file's size, in bytes.

file_type.description:
The AI Companion data file's type. 
* `AIC_CONVERSATION` - AI Companion Conversation file.

physical_files.description: Information about the AI Companion physical query data files.

file_id.description: The AI Companion physical query data file's unique ID.

file_name.description: The AI Companion physical query data file's name.

file_size.description: The AI Companion physical query data file's size, in bytes.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the AI Companion physical query data file. 

 **OAuth apps** 

 If a user has authorized and installed your OAuth app that contains account user scopes, use the user's [OAuth access token](/docs/integrations/oauth/) to download the file. 

 Example: 

 `https://{{base-domain}}/rest/v1/aic/archive/attached/download/xxx--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{OAuth-access-token}}'`.

401.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `401`
Unauthorized Authentication required to access this resource.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `20514`
User does not have permission to access this resource.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `20524`
User does not exist: {userId}.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).
